result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Defendant Teahjah J Zolliecoffer appeared by video.  Attorney Jade K Hall appeared by video for Teahjah J Zolliecoffer.  Attorney Grace M. Gall appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40. This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-7-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report - 09-13-2022

Defendant Teahjah J Zolliecoffer in court.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Teahjah J Zolliecoffer.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8.31.2022
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing (18 pages) commencing  06-16 -22 by Sandra M. Kandziora.

Defendant Teahjah J Zolliecoffer in court, appear in person with attorney Jade K Hall, appear in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective T. Castro.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40. Court remind defendant of active No Contact Order and to maintain contact with Justice Point.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6.16.2022

Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Teahjah J Zolliecoffer in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Teahjah J Zolliecoffer in custody.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Teahjah J Zolliecoffer appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Teahjah J Zolliecoffer not in court.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/4/22 @ 2:30p
